Description: Front of a gilded plaster mummy-mask with inlaid detail including blue glass eye-brows and eyes composed of obsidian and ivory with bronze lashes; uraeus on the fore-head; back lost.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt (Possibly from Alexandria, according to A. Müller 2017.)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. Müller, 2017, 'Provenancing Roman Period mummy masks: workshop groups and distributin areas', in M. Tomorad & J. Popielska-Grzybowska (eds), Proceedings of the seventh European Conference of Egyptologists : Egypt 2015, Archaeopress Egyptology, 129-30.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Capt Edward Louis Gruning
